channel.title: CVE Feed for TeamViewer -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for TeamViewer -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-23242|2024-09-16T16:12:44.258Z -- teamviewer -- teamviewer%20for%20linux
item.description: TeamViewer Linux versions before 15.28 do not properly execute a deletion command for the connection password in case of a process crash. Knowledge of the crash event and the TeamViewer ID as well as either possession of the pre-crash connection password or local authenticated access to the machine would have allowed to establish a remote connection by reusing the not properly deleted connection password.

item.title: CVE-2024-6053|2024-08-28T17:47:14.592Z -- teamviewer -- meeting
item.description: Improper access control in the clipboard synchronization feature in TeamViewer Full Client prior version 15.57 and TeamViewer Meeting prior version 15.55.3 can lead to unintentional sharing of the clipboard with the current presenter of a meeting.

item.title: CVE-2024-1933|2024-08-01T18:56:22.309Z -- teamviewer -- remote%20client
item.description: Insecure UNIX Symbolic Link (Symlink) Following in TeamViewer Remote Client prior Version 15.52 for macOS allows an attacker with unprivileged access, to potentially elevate privileges or conduct a denial-of-service-attack by overwriting the symlink.

item.title: CVE-2024-1933|2024-03-26T12:47:11.238Z -- teamviewer -- remote%20client
item.description: Insecure UNIX Symbolic Link (Symlink) Following in TeamViewer Remote Client prior Version 15.52 for macOS allows an attacker with unprivileged access, to potentially elevate privileges or conduct a denial-of-service-attack by overwriting the symlink.

item.title: CVE-2024-2451|2024-05-28T14:27:25.918Z -- teamviewer -- remote%20%28full%20client%29
item.description: Improper fingerprint validation in the TeamViewer Client (Full & Host) prior Version 15.54 for Windows and macOS allows an attacker with administrative user rights to further elevate privileges via executable sideloading.

item.description: Improper fingerprint validation in the TeamViewer Client (Full & Host) prior Version 15.54 for Windows and macOS allows an attacker with administrative user rights to further elevate privileges via executable sideloading.

item.description: Insecure UNIX Symbolic Link (Symlink) Following in TeamViewer Remote Client prior Version 15.52 for macOS allows an attacker with unprivileged access, to potentially elevate privileges or conduct a denial-of-service-attack by overwriting the symlink.
